Description: The Canton of Bern is looking for several framework contract partners for the provision of infrastructural services (building cleaning, caretaker and house services as well as green maintenance) for the administrative regions of Bern-Mittelland including the city of Bern. The total potential is around 200,000 square metersers (mainly office buildings), plus school facilities. A framework agreement will be concluded with a maximum of 4 companies. The individual services are generally provided decentrally, i.e. directly, by the organizational units of the administration of the Canton of Bern or those responsible for public tasksitself, whereby the order is usually placed using a so-called mini-tender procedure (we reserve the right to place the order directly). input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE OF ROADS ASTRA, DEPARTMENT OF STRASSE INFRASTRUCTURE OST, BRANCH WINTERTHUR BRANCH. Summary: N01/36 Uplans Jonction Schlieren-pont De L-or Was. Description: The very frequented section of the N1H between the limit of the city of Zurich and the Pont de l'Europe, as well as the North and South Bernerstrasse which is parallel to it, have a proven need for rehabilitation with regard to noise, The layout, traffic flows and development. The situation must be decisively improved by reducing the width of traffic lanes, deconstruction of road surfaces, not very noisy surfaces, adaptation of water evacuation, optimization of the overall circulation system and the Construction of an 850 m long noise wall. The development of the road space and the networking of green spaces on this intra-urban section are of key importance here. The present market includes the creation and maintenance of green spaces (in particular plantation and maintenance of trees , Etc.).. Currency: CHF. Published Date: 2023-07-28. Closing Date: 2023-10-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The situation must be decisively improved by reducing the width of traffic lanes, deconstruction of road surfaces, not very noisy surfaces, adaptation of water evacuation, optimization of the overall circulation system and the Construction of an 850 m long noise wall. The services requested from the company are intended for the maintenance and restoration of oaks (cups of gardening, silvicultural care), Works in favor of biodiversity, the maintenance of forest service infrastructure, as well as the maintenance of urban forest massifs and protective forests. The business undertakes to train at least two apprentices forest-bone, forest apprentices -Bûcherons on the duration of the framework contract set for four years. The contracting company must initiate an apprentice or an apprentice at the start of the framework contract and a second or a second in September of the second year of the said contract.. The services requested from the company are intended for the maintenance and restoration of oaks (cups of gardening, silvicultural care), Works in favor of biodiversity, the maintenance of forest service infrastructure, as well as the maintenance of urban forest massifs and protective forests. The business undertakes to train at least two apprentices forest-bone, forest apprentices -Bûcherons on the duration of the framework contract set for four years. The renovation and adaptation of the evacuation of water, protection against noise, the renovation of the superstructure of the road and the works of art are already carried out. The soil surfaces exposed by the construction works have Favored the appearance of invasive neophytes. Description: The Moos lake waterworks, including the Horn pumping station, must be renewed during operation. Services to be provided by the ecological construction supervision: <br> Supervision and monitoring of the relocation of listed orchid green roofs between different roofs or roof areas of thehistoric slow filter systems. Furthermore, advice and control regarding the installation of new green roofs.<br> Accompanying and monitoring the design of all green areas (floor areas) that are to be newly created or renewed after the conversion work has been carried out on the factory premises.<br> Furthermore, theAdvice to the construction management.<br> The implementation will take about 10 years. There is a strong dependency on the other trades working on the project at the same time. Mainly civil engineering works and various construction services, and to a lesser extent chemical engineering processes andd Elektrotechnik.<br> Doc Title: Agricultural, forestry, horticultural, aquacultural and apicultural services<br> Contract Type: Services. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES - UNHCR. Summary: Individual Consultancy to Develop a Global Roadmap to Upscale Refugee Agricultural Livelihoods. Description: Tenders are invited for Individual Consultancy to Develop a Global Roadmap to Upscale Refugee Agricultural Livelihoods    Under the overall supervision of the Head of the Livelihoods and Economic Inclusion Unit in UNHCR HQs and in collaboration with regional and country-based livelihoods and economic inclusion officers, the incumbent will build on data, literature, evidence and analysis to design a roadmap for agriculture, including strategic orientation and partnerships. The consultant will provide the following duties and responsibilities:    ▪ Develop a Workplan at the start of the assignment.    ▪ Map UNHCR-s interventions in agriculture (for self-reliance and livelihoods, nutrition, food security, peaceful co-existence and natural resource management), used standards thus far, identify gaps and opportunities.    ▪ Conduct a literature and desk review of confirmed climate-smart, innovative and sustainable agriculture, agroforestry, land management and habitat restoration practices in refugee hosting countries, with the evidence-base, and the national capacities, partnerships and legal framework needed.    ▪ Identify global key strategic partners for UNHCR to better engage and forge effective strategic partnerships for refugees- agricultural livelihoods and resilience including with development actors, UN agencies, private sector, government, research institutions, and regional and national agriculture alliances; advise UNHCR on the way forward to capitalize on partnerships with BMZ, the World Bank, AfDB, and others to address existing gaps and tap into opportunities for the expansion of inclusive agricultural value chains with the aim of enhancing refugee-s economic inclusion, livelihoods and resilience while sustainably exploiting the required natural resources.    ▪ Engage with existing and potential development partners to identify accordingly priority locations / country operations, including possibly in cross-border areas, to help governments implement the pledges they have made with relation to agriculture for jobs and livelihoods. Several pledges made by hosting countries focused on improving policy and legal frameworks for better access to jobs related to agriculture, to the provision of access to land, access to markets, and skills training. Interventions would focus, for instance, on pledge matching, infrastructure investments for value chain development, natural resource usage monitoring (e.g. groundwater), and the inclusion of refugees in national agricultural development programmes funded by IFIs. Build on UNHCR partnerships with IFIs, FAO, WFP, and the technical support available from the WFP-UNHCR Joint Hub.    ▪ Conduct missions to three selected countries and develop cost-effectiveness analysis and draft concept notes for the sustainable expansion or piloting of promising agricultural interventions in minimum 2 pilot countries.    ▪ Develop a global roadmap for agriculture capitalizing on GRF pledges, partnerships, and opportunities for the expansion of inclusive and sustainable agricultural value chains that enhance the self-reliance, resilience and livelihoods of refugee and host communities while mainstreaming environmental and climate-change related risks.    UNHCR is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people. Every year, millions of men, women and children are forced to flee their homes to escape conflict and persecution. We are in over 125 countries, using our expertise to protect and care for millions.    How to apply:  Interested applicants should submit their Letter of motivation and Personal History Form (PHF) to hqdrsvac@unhcr.org indicating DRS/2021/025, Consultancy to develop a roadmap to upscale refugee agricultural livelihoods in the subject of the email**.**    Personal History Forms are available at PHF Form / Supplementary Sheet.    Applications without PHF Form will not be considered.    The UNHCR workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages and opinions. UNHCR seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity to ensure equal opportunities as well as an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. Applications are encouraged from all qualified candidates without distinction on grounds of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.    ]]. Tender Value: 0. Published Date: 2021-10-16. Closing Date: 2021-10-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: United Nations Secretariat

output.Purchaser_Name: UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES - UNHCR
